intro: Hippocrepis squamata subsp. hieronymi, commonly known as the Hieronymi's squamata, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, preferring sunny and well-drained habitats. Its subspecific classification highlights its unique genetic and morphological traits that distinguish it from other members of the Hippocrepis genus. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
